meanings.definition: A sudden upsetting or surprising event or experience.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise gave me a shock.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news caused a shock in the room.
meanings.sent3: The prank was a shock, but we all laughed afterwards.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather was a shock to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The surprise party was a shock, but it made me happy.

meanings.definition: A sudden physical or mental disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The electric shock made him jump.
meanings.sent2: The shock of losing his job affected him deeply.
meanings.sent3: The shock therapy helped improve his condition.
meanings.sent4: The news came as a shock, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The shock of the cold water woke him up instantly.

meanings.sent1: The shock of the earthquake was felt throughout the city.
meanings.sent2: The shock of the impact caused the glass to break.
meanings.sent3: The shock of the roller coaster ride made her scream with joy.
meanings.sent4: The shock of the explosion could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The shock of the train stopping suddenly threw everyone forward.
